message.content:
A Hendiadys is a figure of speech in which two words or phrases are combined to express a single idea. This linguistic device creates a more vivid and powerful expression by emphasizing the contrast between the two terms joined together. It often involves using synonyms or antonyms to highlight the duality of the concept being expressed.

For example, in the phrase "tears like rivers," the Hendiadys effectively conveys the idea of a tremendous amount of tears flowing, as if rivers were made of tears.
